archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Goan-Style Coconut Fish Curry with Saffron Jeera Rice and Oven-Warmed Naan
description: A festival-worthy coconut fish curry balanced with tamarind, served with fragrant saffron jeera rice and warm naan. Medium heat and layered flavors for a weekend family feast.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Cut 700–800 g fish fillets into large chunks (about 5 cm).
In a bowl, toss fish with 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice; set aside 15 minutes.
Warm 1/4 cup water and pinch saffron together in a small cup; let bloom.
Preheat oven to 180°C for warming naan.
cook_steps: Make the curry base: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wide pot over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds and 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; let them crackle 30 seconds.
Add sliced onions and a pinch of salt; cook 10–12 minutes, stirring, until deep golden.
Stir in minced garlic; cook 1 minute.
Add 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, and 1 teaspoon paprika; stir 30 seconds.
Add 1 can (400 g) diced tomatoes and 1 teaspoon sugar; simmer 6–8 minutes until thick and glossy.
Pour in 400 ml coconut milk and 2 tablespoons tamarind chutney; add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Simmer gently 5 minutes; taste and balance with more tamarind chutney or sugar if needed (medium heat).
Slide in marinated fish pieces in a single layer. Simmer on low 6–8 minutes until just cooked through. Finish with a handful of chopped coriander and a squeeze of lemon.
Cook the rice: In a saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon ghee over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds and 1 bay leaf; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add the drained basmati rice; stir to coat 1 minute. Add 3 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and the bloomed saffron with its water.
Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low; cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes covered. Fluff with a fork.
Warm the naan: Wrap naan in foil and warm in the preheated oven for 5–7 minutes until soft.
Serve: Spoon saffron jeera rice onto a platter, ladle fish curry on the side, scatter with extra coriander, and serve with warm naan and lemon wedges.
